fields.description: It would be nice to be able to from a WinForm SOAP client be able to provide a link to the specific issue.  When enabling this link to be able to pass the session id on the URL as to not have to log in again would be quite handy.
fields.summary: Allow passing SessionID from SOAP client to Browser URL

fields.description:
You should be able to configure all plugins (through the Admin section -> Plugins).

This will enable you to do things like:
* Add permissions to Reports/Charts
* Configure things like macros
* Alter order

Pretty much you wouldn't need to use parameters in the {{atlassian-plugin.xml}} and could even remove some of the other configurations or over-ride some (even views).
fields.summary: Make plugins configurable

fields.description: I was just looking into changing the 'AddNotification'  screen, and noticed that the select tags for the drop downs 'Group' , 'CustomField User/Group picker' aren't closed. Doesn't seem to be causing any problems, but seems worth fixing just for HTML conformity's sake.
fields.summary: Close <select> tags on AddNotification page

fields.description: When the user is creating an issue, they hit Submit, if there is an error on the form (i.e. required field not filled out), the form posts back with the error highlighted, and keeps all the previously filled out values, except for the attachment field.  The user must then Browse to their attachment again before submitting issue.
fields.summary: When Creating Issue, if form has error, lose attachment value

fields.description:
We have noticed that when you run JIRA in IE & (Beta 1 or even the final version from last week). the view button at the top of the filter menu gets stretched across the top. The view button is okay at the bottom.

See attached for an example.
fields.summary: Running JIRA in IE7 shows the view button at the top all stretched

fields.description:
Currently there's no way to tell which custom fields may/must be filled when createIssue is called. So in the case where a (project/type) has a required custom field (and it is not known at compile time), you can't create issues through the remote API.

I suggest to add a method getFieldsForCreate(project, issueType), similar to getFieldsForEdit.
fields.summary: Cannot create an issue through SOAP interface when there's a required custom field. (getFieldsForCreate method is needed)
Improvement suggestions for your online wiki markup help

fields.description:
Currently when resolving an issue you can select the resolution to be 'Duplicate Issue'. This is helpful, but what someone interested in this issue, say JB-2, really wants to know, is which issue the closer thinks this one duplicates, say JB-1. Not specifying the id of the duplicated issue, JB-1 here, adds additional communication overhead as anyone reviewing JB-2  must either review associated documentation to see if anything is mentioned or contact the closer directly to determine what they were thinking at the time they closed the issue. 

The work around at the moment is that you can enter a JIRA id in the comments field, but this is not mandatory.  JIRA should be updated to require a 'Duplicate JIRA ID' field to be filled out when resolving an issue and marking it as a 'Duplicate Issue'.
fields.summary: Should not be able to set resolution as 'Duplicate Issue' without stating which issue it is duplicating.
Optionally hide archived versions or components

fields.description:
Several Atlassian Jira reports fail to draw a chart and give the following error:

This chart shows the number of issues created vs the number of issues resolved  in the last $daysPrevious days..
No chart created. Possibly invalid project or saved filter selected?

Note the "$daysPrevious" in that error message is exactly the text that's displayed. This seems to have something to do with the failure, because the parameters I'm using should produce a chart.

This happens in:
Created vs Resolved Issues
Resolution Time Chart 
Average Age Report
fields.summary: $daysPrevious variable associated with fail in reports
Allow the Update Issue Field Function to setting Remaining Estimate to 0 even when no work has been logged

fields.description: If you add comments to an issue, the comments don't show up in the web. The comments do show up in the email & are there in the database but when you open the issue in JIRA, it doesn't show the comments just the user name who added the comment shows up.
fields.summary: Comments don't show up

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11331]. {panel} Following an old issue (JRA-6481), our requirment for i18n implementation is more and mroe important at the moment. * May we know when a such feature will be implemented in future release ? * Trying to understand how customfield rendering is done, I found a way to apply i18n translation. I proceed so : ** Creating the CustomField as i18n keys : *myCustomField* ** Adding the CustomField property value in a rebuild language_fr_FR.jar {code:title=com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_fr.properties}myCustomField=Mon Champ personnalisé{code} ** Adding the CustomField property value in a rebuild language_en_UK.jar {code:title=com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport_en.properties}myCustomField=My Custom Field{code} ** ... and alos for any other required languages. ** Modifying *templates/plugins/jira/macros.vm* as follow : *** a new Macro {code:actionscript}## I18n Headers required for CustomFields #macro(i18nCustomName $action $name) #set ($wordPos = $name.indexOf(" ")) #if ($wordPos>0) #set($key=$name.substring(0,$wordPos)) $action.getText($key) $name.substring($wordPos,$name.length()) #else $action.getText($name) #end #end{code} *** Replacement of {code:actionscript}#if ($required) * $name: #else $name: #end{code} by {code:actionscript}#if ($required) * #i18nCustomName($action $name) : #else #i18nCustomName($action $name) : #end{code} ** Modify *includes/panels/issue/view_customfields.jsp* as follow : Replacement of {code:html}"> : {code} by {code:html}"> : {code} Please, let me know if I may implement this, waiting the future feature ? What other problem may I encounter ? Probably Word and Excel rendering, I suppose ? Rgds Vincent
fields.summary: I18n with CustomField

fields.description: It would be nice if the built-in Bugzilla importer can import Bugazilla custom fields
fields.summary: Import Bugzilla custom fields

fields.description:
Here is a history of what is happening. Please see below.

 There are a few things that I have noticed within the Production Support project that are not correct:

1 - New release version that have been set up since 7.0.10.1 do not show in any filters

2 - The Unsceduled ticket count in Browse Project / Open Issues / Unscheduled shows as 3 but when you drill into it there are 74 issues?

 Description  	

   There are a few things that I have noticed within the Production Support project that are not correct: 1 - New release version that have been set up since 7.0.10.1 do not show in any filters 2 - The Unsceduled ticket count in Browse Project / Open Issues / Unscheduled shows as 3 but when you drill into it there are 74 issues?

We noted that in the list of the 70-odd "unassigned" issues, exactly three had a status of "dev complete" but apart from that could not spot any trends or discrepencies.


We have concluded that in respect to the "Open Issues" panel of the "Production Support" project:

- The reason that we only see the 4 listed versions (7.0.11.0, 7.0.12.0, 8.0.1.0 and 8.0.2.0) is because the other versions (as seen on "Roadmap") do not have any open issues. As you noted, the word "open" is very important. These issues are different from unresolved issues.

- I cant seem to isolate any reasons why the unresolved count is incorrect (or by so much!).

Heres what I tried:
- Have quickly scanned through Atlassian's JIRA and there doesnt appear to be any current bugs surrounding this functionality.
- Have tried a variety of different filtering options to try and get a result of "3", to no avail. The smallest number I can get is 7, which is achieved by setting the filter to "Product Support" project, "No Fix Versions", selecting "None" for Affect versions and setting the status to "Open" only. This is still pointless though since 7 isnt 3!
- Looked through the source for the report thats being run. At a glance (about 5 minutes), theres nothing out of the ordinary that indicates a completely different search is being run to produce the numbers.

Any advise?
fields.summary: filter problem

fields.description:
Some i18n text (for example, German) seems to have very long translations for "Workflow notification", etc.  See attached screenshot.

This makes the heading/link move past the end of the admin pane.  Possible fix could be to either grow the pane to accomodate the text, or wrap the text( ? ) to the next line.
fields.summary: Long i18n strings are too big to fit inside admin menu

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1. Create a user so they essentially become a member of the jira-user group
2. Remove all permissions associated with the jira-user group
3. Have that user login (the login screen is blank as expected)
4. Once logged in they are able to browse projects on the dashboard as well as access the Browse Project Tab

Although users can't specifically view issues (which is correct) they can still see project information.

This was raised at [JSP-7548|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-7548].
fields.summary: User with no permissions granted is still able to browse projects once logged in

Bugzilla importer is incorrectly mapping issue links

fields.description: This happens to me /all/ the time: start writing a Jira issue report (like this one :() or a wiki page, then realize I made a typo, so hit ctrl-B.  I hit this because of the deeply ingrained muscle memory that Emacs has given me.  Unfortunately, ctrl-B will royally hose you because it's a shortcut for "browser back".  Of course at that point, you've completely lost everything you've been editing and there's no way to get it back.  Other shortcuts will do the same thing (ctrl-A too IIRC).  I really just want to shut off the keyboard shortcuts all together. :(
fields.summary: Allow users to turn off keyboard shortcuts

{code}
public class GroupPermissionCheckerImpl implements GroupPermissionChecker
{
    private PermissionManager permissionManager;

    public GroupPermissionCheckerImpl(PermissionManager permissionManager)
    {
        this.permissionManager = permissionManager;
    }

    public boolean hasViewGroupPermission(String group, User user)
    {
        // Admins can view all groups
        if (permissionManager.hasPermission(Permissions.ADMINISTER, user))
            return true;

        // User can only view groups in which they are members
        return user.inGroup(group);
    }
}
{code}

Just need to check for {{user == null}} case.

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian,

I would like a report which would display a snapshot of the progress of any version.  The x-axis would be time, and the y-axis would be number of issues.  Then, with a color-coded legend, the number of issues in each workflow state would be indicated as a bar for each day.

Attached is a screenshot from our JIRA system (UnresolvedIssueReports.jpg), which displays the total number of issues in our 2.20.1 release, which of course increases over time.  Below that, in green, is the total number of 'resolved' issues.  Since the only issues which change from 'Unresolved' to 'Resolved' are those which are closed or reopened, we have difficulty tracking the progress of the project.  I need to see how many issues are submitted, open, fixed, testing, passed, reopened, or closed.  Since we only close issues before the release if they are duplicates, or 'won't fix', there is no way for me to track the health of the project.  Additionally, since the reopened issues automatically get the 'reopened' resolution, we could be in trouble, believing that resolved issues are good.  We get around this by setting passed issues to have a non-unresolved resolution, but I'ld like some more granularity.

I am also attaching a screenshot from an Excel report that sort-of does what I expect.  Note the colored bars indicating total number of items in each status.  Of course, I would really want to order the bars in a workflow that makes sense (Submitted > Open > Fixed > Testing > Passed > Reopened (Failed) > Closed) and then you get into the issue that the workflow statuses must be numbered by an administrator, so that they aren't just sorted alphabetically.  You can see from the screenshot how easy it is to watch the number of submitted items decrease as the number of testing and passed items increase.  If items get moved to future versions (as they do frequently), then you can easily determine the number of issues in the release from the top line.

I could prose on, but I don't want to submit more than one idea per issue.

Thanks
grace@geospiza.com
fields.summary: Add a report which displays progress by status

fields.description:
This is a request for the ability to set up Jira so that all issues are generated from the same counter.

Say there are two projects ABC and XYZ and in issue is raised in the first project.  The issue might be given the number ABC-123.

The issue is then transferred to the second project and gets the number XYZ-456.  Both parts of the issue name change - both the key and the number - and the issue loses its original identity entirely.

This is because each project gets its own counter.  If all projects used the same counter then the number part of the issue name would alone be sufficient to ensure uniqueness.

Therefore an issue that moved from one project to another would receive a new key - but would not need to be renumbered: e.g. ABC-123 would simply become XYZ-123.

This would ensure that it retained something of its original identity and would facilitate searching and finding issues.
fields.summary: Set up Jira so that every issue has a unique number rather than a unique number - key combination

fields.description: This is a suggestion for a feature that would be very useful for organizations with staff turn-over. I'm imagining a one-step "archive" command for users that would: 1) strip the user of all permissions, 2) prevent the user from logging in, 3) disallow assigning issues to the user. The difference between this and deleting the user is that issues that are currently assigned to the user or were reported by the user would retain the link back to the user. An extra bonus would be if an interim screen allowed you to bulk reassign (or unassign) any issues currently assigned to the user when you perform the archive.
fields.summary: Add the ability to archive users

Background: we create many JIRA tasks using email forwarding rules in Outlook. Many of these establish the situation described above.

Please either change the code so that it doesn't remove the <CR>, or change it so that it doesn't recognize that as a change to the description, and thus "Change History" won't show the change.

fields.description:
Custom Field Sorters need to implement equals and hashcode because Lucene caches them.

In JIRA 3.6 and earlier this didn't matter because the cache, keyed by Searcher was cleaned up on every request because a new Searcher was created for every request.

In JIRA 3.7, Searchers are longer lived and so the cache can fill up over many HTTP requests causing many megabytes of excess memory to be used in some cases.
fields.summary: Field Sorters do not implement equals and hashcode causing excess memory consumption

fields.description:
Jira will allow you to use 'Bulk Edit' feature to change the issue type without regard for the different workflow that may be tied to that issue type.  And if that different workflow has other states (i.e. does not contain the state that the issue is currently in), you could end up with an "orphaned issue". That is, the issue is left in a state that does not correspond to its current workflow and hence no transitions can be performed.  Once this occurs, it cannot be fixed with bulk edit, transition or move. It can only be cloned and then deleted.  

This is not an issue if the workflow scheme maps the same workflow are all issue types (e.g. they fall under the 'all unmapped issue types" setting) or if the same states exist in the different workflows.  However, Jira does not check for this. It should either disallow the change of issue type during bulk edit operations, or it should issue a warning to the user.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit allows change of issue type without regard for the associated workflow - thereby creating orphaned issues

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 27 November 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

As of JIRA 7 (released on October 6, 2015), new projects are not created using the default issue type scheme. Depending on which project template you choose, a fresh set of schemes will be created for you. These new schemes do not use the default issue type scheme.

If you would like to create a project that uses the same schemes as an existing project, we have introduced a new "Created with shared configuration" feature when creating projects. Simply select an existing project, and JIRA will create a new project that shares all the same schemes as the existing project. [Learn more here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/defining-a-project-749382822.html].

While we have kept the default issue type scheme for now, it is not used by default unless specifically selected and we expect to remove it in a future release.
Regards,
Dave Meyer
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

By default, all newly created issue types are automatically added to the Default Issue Type Scheme.  However, we have some specific issue types for use with non-global projects that need not be shared amongst all other projects.  (Most of our projects are using the Default Issue Type Scheme for simplicity.)  It would be nice if either:

1) the "remove" functionality was added to this scheme; or
2) newly created issue types never even made it to the Default Scheme.
fields.summary: Remove Issue Types from the Default Issue Type Scheme

fields.description: As of now, once one assigns a workflow scheme to a project, it's not possible to change the Workflow and the steps any more. While the reasons behind this are clear, this is a too restrictive limitation. If modification to workflows which have been assigned to active projects are not in conflict with what's been assigned, administrators should be able to change things like steps descriptions. More importantly, administrators should be able to add a transition to a step or even a step, if these information are not in conflict with what's been already assigned. I'd add that, should these information be in conflict, a screen on how to resolve conflicts would be all that's required.
fields.summary: Please allow for Steps names in workflows to be modified even when these have been assigned to an Active workflow scheme
Please add capability in JIRA for the "Project Lead" to be able to add & modify "Components" for their project without having to make the "Project Lead" part of the "administrator" Group.

fields.description:
Internally I am using your AssociationManager class to create associations between user and project objects. 
Everything works fine as expected, but on a delete of either an user or an project object, the responding association is not being deleted.
Apart from causing trouble in my application, this behaviour is different if an ordinary association is created by the AssociationManager between
two non-user objects. In that case the associations are deleted as expected.
do you have a fast workaround for that problem?
fields.summary: userassociation is not being deleted if associated object or user is deleted

fields.description:
Thumbnails created in a wiki renderer from an attached image do not have a link to the original full sized image. This forces users to have to leave the field they are in and have to go to the image attachment section to be able to view the full sized image. Making inline thumbnails somewhat useless.

I am pretty sure that the thumbnails did link to the full sized image in Jira 3.6.1 when the renderers were first introduced (or was that 3.5??). In any case this really should be fixed. I am actually going live in a few weeks and would like to get a patch for this.
fields.summary: Thumbnails in wiki renderer do not link to the full sized image

fields.description:
When creating a new JIRA project, we use the function "import data from CSV file" to create some initial issues we need in every project. 
Both steps, creating the project and importing the data, are done by our JIRA admins. This is ok for setting up a new project.

Now we found it helpful also to import CSV files created from an Excel file which is written during testing with one of our customers. This works fine!
The problem: if more of our project managers hear about this smart import feature, our JIRA admins will not do anything else but importing CSV files ;-)

I would appreciate the following feature:
1. A special permission "Import issues from CSV file" that I can grant to project managers.
2. A dialog that requires this permission, and that allows only the CSV file import, perhaps with fixed names for CSV file and mapping file.
fields.summary: Provide an extra permission to import a fix named CSV file with a fix named mapping file
SOAP: Populate field's type and its available/default values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11179].
  {panel}

How do we select which issues to consider when voting?  Aside from stumbling over something with a search, the obvious thing that probably most of us do is to work our way down the list of most popular issues, stopping when we've had enough (way before we've seen all).  This approach is about as statistically flawed as you can get.  (The other way we do it is to sort by most-recent; that is a relatively fair sampling.)

At the top of every JIRA page, there should be a short summary of a randomly-selected votable issue, sort of like an advertisement. If you click on it, it opens in a new window, so you don't lose your place.

Only insiders should be allowed to see the list sorted by votes, and the vote count for an issue should be shown to users only when the issue is selected for the next release.

If JIRA will do these things, voting will be a better statistical sample of what users want.
fields.summary: Voting should be fair: never show issues sorted by popularity; show them randomly; never show votes during voting

fields.description:
JIRA's webapp edition builds a .war file instead of webapp in an open directory. This causes various problems:

 - When users have to edit a config file, they have to go through all the hoopla or rebuilding the .war file. 
 - When we ask for a file (eg. entityengine.xml or subversion-jira-plugin.properties), users can't simply give it to us. 
 - Tomcat seems to ignore the unpackWARs="false" directive, and unpacks the webapp to webapps/atlassian-jira/. Users are then tempted to edit this copy. Tomcat itself can also get confused, and ignore changes to the webapp in favour of files from webapps/.
fields.summary: Fix the WAR/Webapp edition to build an open webapp (not a .war)

fields.description:
Since we didn't find solution for auto create user on login , while using LDAP authentication, I wrote a small feature to do that

The feature is auto create user on login
User will be created only if the user exists in LDAP.
The algorithm is like that:

If user already Exist in Jira continue as usual, nothing changed 
If user don't exist in Jira create the user (add him to jira-users and jira-developers and autocreated-users group and also set his mail (hard coded : username@amdocs.com), autocreated-users group will be created if not exist ) 
on LDAP authentication: check if user exist in LDAP 
if user not exist in LDAP delete it 
authenticate the user in LDAP 
user logged in 
 
In order to implement this feature (by the way it was tested on Jira  3.6 only), I attached zip file with sources and classes
extract  the com.zip file and put the sub directories under  : [jira installation]\WEB-INF\classes\com

We find it very useful, hope it will be included in Jira future versions
Meir Ivgi

fields.description:
Overall health report
This report is a calculation that calculates the days of over or under run of the time it should have taken to resolve an issue. The calculation is as follows:
*A* = Due date - Creation Date
*B* = Resolution Date - Creation Date
*C* = ((B - A) / A) * 100% (=Health indicatior)

Should be possibility choose Project (Filter), Period and Priorities

This calculation will thread a 1 day overrun on a "Blocker" as worse than 1 day overrun on "Critical" etcetera. *C* can therefore have the following values:
<0% - Issues is solved before planning
=0% - Issue is solved right on planning
>0% - Issue is behind planning
In an healthy situation Health should be in most cases <0 meaning we deliver constantly in time.
fields.summary: Overall health report

fields.description: This was a problem with the TimeInStatusCFT from the charting plugin. The removeValue method tries to do a findByAnd with the value in the custom field and this makes a value= in sql, which mssql does not handle for unlimited text fields. This method needs to either, not try to compare on the value (we need to investigate the implications of changing the behavior of the method) or we need a new method that will just delete the values for the issue.
fields.summary: CustomFieldValuePersister.removeValue fails if the value is of type unlimited text in mssql

fields.description:
So I'm starting out with JIRA.  I create some users. What groups should they be in?  I go to the Group Browser page.  I see jira-developers and jira-administrators.  What are these?  I look for tool tips by mousing over them.  Nothing.  I look for a help button or link on the page.  Nothing.

This is not a good online help user experience.

Please take some time and bring JIRA up to best practices in the area of online help.
fields.summary: tool tips, online help?
